author: Special Correspondent
text:
District Collector K.S. Palanisamy on Saturday inaugurated the pasting of awareness stickers on the premises of Automated Teller Machines of banks in the district to sensitise people on the need to exercise their franchise without fail.

The sensitisation drive is part of the SVEEP (Systematic Voters’ Education and Electoral Participation) implemented by the Election Commission.

The stickers would be pasted in all the 359 ATMs in the district.

The drive seeks to drive home the message that all those who have attained the age of 18 should enrol their names in the voters list and ensuring cent per cent polling in the Assembly election.

Meanwhile, the Federation of Consumer and Service Organisations launched a voters awareness campaign in the city by distributing pamphlets.

Sanjay Mathur, Commissioner of Police, inaugurated the campaign near the bus stand in the presence of M. Sekaran, president, and other members of the federation.

The pamphlets urged voters to help achieve the target of achieving cent per cent polling and desist from accepting cash or kind to vote. Voters can exercise the option of NOTA, it said.
title: ATMs too will carry message for vote
